events.name: Event Series: Astronaut Jeff Williams in Singapore
events.description:
What is it like to spend 534 days away from Planet Earth?
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
NASA Astronaut Commander Jeffrey Williams will be at a series of programs this August, to share his extensive experience living aboard the ISS and the 5 spacewalks he has completed.
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
Space technology is developing quickly. Global options in space-related careers are expected to grow in the coming years. Come and hear firsthand experiences in outer space today, to look out for tomorrow's opportunities! 
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
1st August (Tues)
9am-12pm: Meet & Greet, Talk
 • Venue: Nanyang Polytechnic, Theatre for the Arts, Blk A Level 2
 • Admission: Free
 • Perks: Tea reception, first 100 registrants receive free autographed postcard of Commander Williams
 • Register: www.bit.ly/spacenyp
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
6pm-8pm: Entrepreneurs - Kopi Chat w/ Jeff Williams
 • Venue: Blk 71, Ayer Rajah Cres, #02-01
 • Admission: Free
 • Perks: Hear about challenges & opportunities in the NewSpace industry, limited autographed litographs will be given away after the event
 • Register: https://www.eventnook.com/event/augustkopichat1/
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
2nd August (Wed)
9:15am-11:15am: Meet & Greet, Talk
 • Venue: NTU Campus
 • Admission: Free
 • Perks: Explore tech innovations in connecting outer space to Earth, take photos with Jeff Williams
 • Register: https://wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/REGISTER_NTU.REGISTER?EVENT_ID=OA17071209121734
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
2:30-3:30pm: Meet & Greet, Talk
 • Venue: SUTD Auditorium 
 • Admission: Free
 • Perks: Explore tech innovations in connecting outer space to Earth. Limited autographed litographs available or bring your own memorabilia
• Register: https://sutd.edu.sg/jeffwilliams?utm_source=admissions&utm_campaign=jeffwilliams
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
7pm: Fireside Chat w/ Jeff Williams
 • Venue: Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-01
 • Admission: Will be open to the public by the end of the week (follow this page for updates)
  ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
5th August (Sat)
10am-12pm: Meet & Greet, Conversation w/ Jeff Williams
 • Venue: Science Centre, Maxwell Auditorium
 • Admission: Free, but admission fee to Science Centre applies
 • Perks: Interact with Jeffrey Williams through engaging conversation
 • Register: http://www.science.edu.sg/events/Pages/spacetalk.aspx
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍
2pm-3pm: Space Talk with Jeffrey Williams @ CodingGirls SG
 • Venue: A*StartCentral, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-03
 • Perks: Learn about life in space!
 • Register: http://peatix.com/event/287471

3pm-5pm: CubeSat Workshop - An Introduction to Coding Space Systems
 • Venue: A*StartCentral, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-03
 • Admission: Fee for workshop materials, please see registration link below. Group discounts for students!
 • Perks: Build a mini satellite with a camera payload, learn how to program an interface, and transmit images from your CubeSat to Mission Control
 • Register: http://peatix.com/event/285669
 ‍‍‍‍‍
About the Organizer
www.bse-space.com
Bhattacharya Space Enterprises (BSE) is a Singapore-based space technology training company that brings outer space research to local students. On 4 June 2017, it helped high school students launch Singapore's first experiment to the International Space Station, as featured on Straits Times & TODAY.
 ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍
Like & Follow our Facebook Page for more NewSpace news and events in the region.
events.location: Bhattacharya Space Enterprises, LaunchPad @ one-north, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139955

events.name: Setting up and securing your own VM private server
events.description:
Taking control of your own Linux server is an opportunity to try new things and leverage the power and flexibility of a great platform. However, Linux server administrators must take the same caution that is appropriate with any network-connected machine to keep it secure and safe.
There are many different security topics that fall under the general category of "Linux security" and many opinions as to what an appropriate level of security looks like for a Linux server.
The main thing to take away from this is that you will have to decide for yourself what security protections will be necessary. Before you do this, you should be aware of the risks and the trade offs, and decide on the balance between usability and security that makes sense for you.
 

AGENDA

Setup AWS machine
Setup SSH key
Login without password through SSH
Secure and harden your SSH config
Update your firewall to only allow access through SSH / HTTP / HTTPS
Setup fail2ban
Change your shell to fish and plugins around it
Install nginx and upload a static website


MEET THE PEOPLE



Neerav Kumar 
Site Reliability Engineer, Cloudflare | Singapore
First SRE hired in Singapore, my job involves setting up and maintaining servers across more than 100+ locations around the world handling, accelerating and protecting a significant portion of the internet and building automation; started the Singapore Docker Meetup around it.


REQUIREMENTS


Participants to bring laptop and credit card to sign up for hosting account 
Participants are expected to have basic knowledge of the commander prompt in Linux or Mac along with Git Bash for Windows

RESERVING A SEAT

Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat.
events.location: Innovation Room, 73B Ayer Rajah Crescent,  Singapore 139952, Singapore null
